instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D9701: What is D9701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight. Sometimes it has backlight
threads.message:
Hi there!

Have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> here where i thought the LVDS cable was the issue. I thought it had no image. When i replaced the LVDS cable it worked for about 5 seconds. then the backlight came on and off repeatedly as if the macbook was going to sleep and waking up. It was a fade backlight animation and not a straight on/off. then backlight went out completely. 

have tried another LVDS and the backlight is completely off with several LDS cables

board looks pristine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight. Sometimes it has backlight
threads.message: Check under led driver for corossion? Maybe try reflowing it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight. Sometimes it has backlight
threads.message:
Does the image remain, only backlight goes off?
Check LCD connector first.
Next, check XW9720; continuity between pin2/<DIODE>D9701</DIODE> and FB/<CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.

Don't forget to measure <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal.
